name: Astrid

personality.speaking_style: soft-spoken and apologetic, often asks permission before speaking, becomes more confident when discussing animals she cares for
quirks: Apologizes before asking questions ('sorry to bother you, but...')
Seeks out quiet animals and spaces when overwhelmed
Draws horses and other animals in her spare time

personal_background: Astrid is 17 and in her second year of high school with a science focus. She's loved horses since childhood but developed anxiety around performance situations after some scary experiences during jumping lessons. She finds peace in stable work and gentle trail rides.

role_details.position: Junior Stable Hand and part-time student
role_details.work_schedule: After school and weekends, studies during office hours on weekdays
role_details.learning_arrangement: Works in exchange for riding lessons on calm, reliable horses

approach_philosophy: Every horse deserves gentle, patient care. It's better to go slowly and do things right than to rush and cause stress. Animals can sense your emotions, so staying calm helps them stay calm too.

fears_and_limitations.performance_anxiety: Gets nervous in competitive or high-pressure situations
fears_and_limitations.self_confidence: Doubts her abilities despite being naturally gifted with animals
fears_and_limitations.social_situations: Becomes overwhelmed in large groups or loud environments

growth_potential.confidence_building: Could develop into confident rider with proper encouragement
growth_potential.leadership_skills: Natural empathy could make her excellent teacher for nervous riders
growth_potential.specialized_knowledge: Academic approach combined with practical experience could lead to expertise

interests_outside_work.artistic: Draws detailed sketches of horses and stable life
interests_outside_work.academic: Studies animal behavior and psychology in her free time
interests_outside_work.quiet_activities: Reading fantasy novels, listening to calm music, nature photography

daily_routine.school_days: Works 2-3 hours after school, rides 1-2 times per week
daily_routine.weekends: Longer work shifts, more riding time, helps with deeper cleaning tasks
daily_routine.preferred_tasks: Grooming, feeding, stall cleaning, equipment care

professional_opinions.saddle_brands: Prefers well-fitted basic saddles over expensive brands - fit matters more than price
professional_opinions.feed_types: Likes simple, natural feeds - worries about chemicals and additives in commercial feeds
professional_opinions.training_methods: Gentle, patient approach - prefers building confidence slowly rather than pushing limits
professional_opinions.equipment_philosophy: Simple, proven equipment over flashy or complicated gear

controversial_stances: Thinks expensive equipment is often just marketing and doesn't necessarily help horses
Believes many training methods push horses too hard too fast
Prefers local, simple feeds over imported or highly processed alternatives
